item.name: auth
Login
item.description:
# Web App Login Flow (wb-login)

This folder documents the end-to-end mobile-based login sequence for the web app, from OTP initiation to session logout. Use these requests in order.

## Purpose

- Validate a user’s mobile number, confirm OTP, create an authenticated session, and end the session securely.
    

## Prerequisites

- Environment variable `{{baseUrl}}` is required and should point to the target API host for your environment.
    

## Step-by-step Flow

1) Verify Mobile Number

- Method/Path: POST {{baseUrl}}/auth/confirmMobileNumber
    
- Purpose: Initiate verification by submitting the user’s mobile number to trigger an OTP.
    
- Expected Input (body): mobileNumber (string), countryCode (string), optionally trackId or correlation id if supported.
    
- Expected Output: 200/202 indicating OTP sent; response includes a reference (e.g., requestId/trackId) if applicable.
    

2) Confirm OTP

- Method/Path: POST {{baseUrl}}/auth/verifyMobileOTP
    
- Purpose: Validate the OTP received on the user’s mobile.
    
- Expected Input (body): mobileNumber (string), otp (string/code), and any reference/trackId returned in step 1 (if applicable).
    
- Expected Output: 200 indicating successful verification; may include a short-lived verification token or a flag enabling login.
    

3) Login & Generate Session Token

- Method/Path: POST {{baseUrl}}/auth/login
    
- Purpose: Authenticate the verified user and issue a session token.
    
- Expected Input (body): mobileNumber (string), password/pin OR previously issued verification artifact (e.g., nonce/sessionKey), depending on server config.
    
- Expected Output: 200 with session credentials (e.g., access token/session token) and user context/claims.
    

4) Logout

- Method/Path: PUT {{baseUrl}}/auth/logout
    
- Purpose: Invalidate the active session token and clean up server-side session state.
    
- Expected Input: Authorization header bearing the current session token.
    
- Expected Output: 200/204 confirming successful logout.

Overview  
This folder contains extended authentication and validation utilities beyond core login. Use these endpoints to validate identifiers, drive sign-up flows, and obtain tokens used by downstream services.

Subfolders

- checkMobileNumber: Verifies if a mobile number exists and performs pre-OTP checks.
    - Input: Mobile number (E.164 or local format as supported), optional country code.
        
    - Output: Existence/eligibility flags; may include a track/reference ID to proceed with OTP verification.
        
- checkDoctorId: Validates that a doctorID exists in the system.
    - Input: doctorId.
        
    - Output: Boolean/status indicating presence; minimal profile context if applicable.
        
- signUp: Endpoints supporting new user registration.
    - Input: Registration payload (e.g., name, email, mobile, password/OTP, and any required consents).
        
    - Output: Account creation status; user identifiers and/or auth token on success.
        
- checkEmailId: Validates email availability/uniqueness.
    - Input: email.
        
    - Output: Availability status; guidance if already registered.
        
- getTokenForApp: Obtains tokens for app-to-app or service interactions where applicable.
    - Input: Client/app credentials or prior grant as applicable.
        
    - Output: Access token (and refresh token if supported) plus expiry metadata.
        
- editor-login: Authentication for the editor role.
    - Input: Editor credentials or OTP-based factors as configured.
        
    - Output: Session/auth token and role/permissions scope.
        

Variables

- Base URL: All requests reference {{baseUrl}} from the active environment. Update the environment to switch between deployments (dev/stage/prod).

This folder contains APIs related to authorization and signup.

While signup doctor needs to confirm few things like

- doctorID
    
- mobile number
    

For these we have different APIs in this folder.

While signingup OR logging in we are create session for the user and store it in the DB. This is used to check user access whenever any API is hit.

request.description:
Purpose  
Update the email address associated with an ABHA profile.

Endpoint and Method

- POST {{baseUrl}}/updateABHAemail/updateEmail
    

Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    

Auth and Variables

- This request uses variables:
    - {{baseUrl}} (environment variable)
        
    - {{bearerToken}} (request-scoped variable if you add Bearer Auth). If auth is required by your gateway, set Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}.
        

Request Body (JSON)

- Content-Type: application/json
    
- Schema:  
    {  
    "email": "string",  
    "abhaNumber": "string",  
    "mobileNumber": "string"  
    }
    
- Field descriptions:
    - email: New email address to be updated for the ABHA profile. Must be a valid email format.
        
    - abhaNumber: ABHA number of the profile whose email needs to be updated. Example format: 12-3456-7890-12.
        
    - mobileNumber: Registered mobile number linked to the ABHA profile for verification/association.
        

Sample Request  
POST {{baseUrl}}/updateABHAemail/updateEmail  
Headers:

- Content-Type: application/json  
    Body:  
    {  
    "email": "[user@example.com](https://mailto:user@example.com)",  
    "abhaNumber": "12-3456-7890-12",  
    "mobileNumber": "9876543210"  
    }
    

Sample Responses

- 201 Created (Request Successful) — see saved example: [Request Successful](https://example/46178638-01c6ec9c-e8c0-4464-82a8-a9657e2)
    
- 429 Too Many Requests (Rate limit exceeded) — see saved example: [Rate limit exceeded](https://example/46178638-1fc28ff1-9b3c-4037-acce-fb99a5e)
    

Success Conditions

- The provided abhaNumber exists and is associated with the provided mobileNumber.
    
- The email is in a valid format and passes server-side validation.
    
- Any required authorization is valid and the caller has permissions to update the profile.
    

Error Conditions (non-exhaustive)

- 400 Bad Request: Missing or invalid fields (e.g., invalid email format, abhaNumber not in expected format).
    
- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid bearer token (if auth enforced).
    
- 403 Forbidden: Authenticated caller lacks permission to update the profile.
    
- 404 Not Found: No ABHA profile found for the given abhaNumber.
    
- 409 Conflict: Email already associated with another profile or update conflict.
    
- 429 Too Many Requests: Rate limiting triggered. See saved example above.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error: Unexpected server error.
    

Notes

- Ensure {{baseUrl}} points to the correct environment (e.g., dev/sandbox/prod).
    
- If your deployment enforces bearer auth, add Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}} to the request headers or set auth at the folder/collection level to inherit.
    
- Use the saved examples linked above to mock responses or validate status codes.
    

Related references

- This request appears in multiple places across workspaces. For guidance on headers/body derived from workspace data, see:
    - [Update email address in ABHA profile](https://request/46178638-5cdf76f8-2ae5-47d2-8de1-1854b59363b6)
        
    - [Update email address in ABHA profile](https://request/46178638-364eaac2-069a-43f7-ab10-6f884214fbb1)

header.description: Added as a part of security scheme: bearer

item.description:
Purpose of this API

- Initiate ABHA profile deletion by sending an OTP to the mobile linked with the provided Aadhaar/ABHA identifier. This OTP is required to authorize the deletion in the next step.
    

Request Method

- POST
    

Endpoint

- {{baseUrl}}/deleteUsingAadhaar/getOTPonAadhaar
    

Auth Required

- Typically Bearer token via a workspace variable (e.g., {{bearerToken}}) if your gateway enforces auth. If this request currently works without it, you can skip. Otherwise add:
    
    - Header: Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}
        

Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    

Request Body (JSON)

- Schema: { "abhaNumber": "string", "mobileNumber": "string" }
    
- Notes:
    
    - abhaNumber: ABHA/ABHA Address associated with the identity to be deleted.
        
    - mobileNumber: Mobile number linked to Aadhaar/ABHA that will receive the OTP.
        

Important Notes

- Make sure {{baseUrl}} resolves from the active environment (currently wb-dev-env).
    
- If your gateway requires rate-limiting headers or correlation IDs, consider adding:
    
    - x-track-id: {{trackId}} (if used in your workspace)
        
- This request does not have pre-request or test scripts yet. If desired, I can add:
    
    - Pre-request: generate a trackId and ensure Authorization header is set from variables.
        
    - Tests: assert 2xx status, presence of OTP transaction reference, and response time thresholds.

This folder contains the APIs to delete an ABHA profile using Aadhaar verification. It covers the end-to-end flow: requesting an OTP linked to the Aadhaar number and verifying that OTP to authorize and complete the deletion. Use this for testing, debugging, and onboarding to the ABHA delete-by-Aadhaar process across environments.

Subfolders:

- getOTPonAadhaar — Sends an OTP to the mobile number linked with the provided Aadhaar for deletion consent.
    
- verifyDeleteABHAOTP — Verifies the OTP to authorize and finalize the ABHA profile deletion.

item.name: usingaadhaarotpforMobile

request.description:
This endpoint generates an OTP (One-Time Password) for mobile verification using Aadhaar authentication.

**Purpose:**  
Initiate mobile verification by sending an OTP to the user's registered mobile number linked with their Aadhaar.

**Request Body:**

- `type` (string, required): Specifies the type of OTP generation (e.g., 'MOBILE').
    
- `abhaID` (string, required): The ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) ID of the user.
    

**Expected Response:**  
A successful request returns a response indicating OTP generation status. Refer to the saved example 'Request Successful' for a typical response structure.

**Usage Notes:**

- Ensure both `type` and `abhaID` are provided in the request body.
    
- The Content-Type header must be set to `application/json`.
    
- This endpoint is typically used as the first step in mobile number verification workflows.

item.description:
This endpoint generates an OTP (One-Time Password) for mobile verification using Aadhaar authentication.

**Usage Notes:**

- Ensure both `type` and `abhaID` are provided in the request body.
    
- The Content-Type header must be set to `application/json`.
    
- This endpoint is typically used as the first step in mobile number verification workflows.

item.name: registerWithVerifyAbhaNumber

request.description:
## Summary

This endpoint registers a user by verifying their ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) number. It is used to link a doctor to a verified ABHA number using provided authentication tokens.

## Request Body Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| abhaNumber | string | The ABHA number to be verified and registered. |
| token | string | The authentication token for the session. |
| refreshtoken | string | The refresh token for renewing authentication. |
| doctorID | string | The unique identifier of the doctor. |

## Authentication Requirements

- Requires a valid `token` and `refreshtoken` in the request body.
    
- No additional headers or API keys are required beyond `Content-Type: application/json`.
    

## Sample Request

``` http
POST {{baseUrl}}/verifyAbhaWeb/registerWithVerifyAbhaNumber
Content-Type: application/json
{
  "abhaNumber": "1234-5678-9012",
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "refreshtoken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "doctorID": "DOC123456"
}

 ```

## Sample Response

``` json
{
  "status": "Created",
  "message": "User registered and ABHA number verified successfully."
}

 ```

## Reference

See the saved example: **Request Successful** for a real request/response pair.

item.name: registerWithVerifyAbhaAddress

request.description:
## Overview
This endpoint registers a user by verifying their ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) address. It is typically used by healthcare providers to onboard users into the system after validating their ABHA credentials.

## Required Request Headers
| Header         | Value            | Description                        |
|---------------|------------------|------------------------------------|
| Content-Type  | application/json | Specifies that the request body is in JSON format. |

## JSON Body Schema
```
{
  "abhaNumber": "<string>",
  "token": "<string>",
  "refreshtoken": "<string>",
  "doctorID": "<string>"
}
```
- **abhaNumber**: The unique ABHA number of the user to be registered.
- **token**: The authentication token obtained after ABHA address verification.
- **refreshtoken**: The refresh token for session renewal.
- **doctorID**: The identifier of the doctor performing the registration.

## Example Request
```
POST {{baseUrl}}/verifyAbhaWeb/registerWithVerifyAbhaAddress
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "abhaNumber": "1234-5678-9012",
  "token": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "refreshtoken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
  "doctorID": "DOC12345"
}
```

## Example Response
```
{
  "status": "Created"
}
```

## Usage Notes
- Ensure that the `token` and `refreshtoken` are valid and not expired.
- The `doctorID` should correspond to a registered doctor in the system.
- The endpoint will return a status of `Created` upon successful registration.
- For more details, refer to the [register With Verify Abha Address](request/46178638-cb1e7299-daa6-48ab-a0c1-47d92b60f1cc) request and its [saved example](request/46178638-cb1e7299-daa6-48ab-a0c1-47d92b60f1cc) in this collection.

item.name: verifyABHAprofileOtp
Verify OTP for ABHA profile creation

request.description:
## Verify OTP for ABHA Profile Creation

### Summary
This endpoint verifies the One-Time Password (OTP) sent to a user's mobile number as part of the ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) profile creation process. It ensures that the provided Aadhaar number and mobile number are valid and that the OTP matches the one sent to the user.

### Request Body Parameters
| Parameter     | Type   | Description                                      |
|--------------|--------|--------------------------------------------------|
| `aadhaar`    | string | The 12-digit Aadhaar number of the user.         |
| `otp`        | string | The OTP received on the user's mobile number.     |
| `mobileNumber` | string | The mobile number linked to the Aadhaar.         |

**All parameters are required.**

### Authentication
- Requires a Bearer Token in the `Authorization` header.
- The token should be referenced as `{{bearerToken}}` in your environment or collection variables.

Example:
```
Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}
```

### Example Request
```
POST {{baseUrl}}/verifyABHAprofileOtp
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}

{
  "aadhaar": "123412341234",
  "otp": "123456",
  "mobileNumber": "9876543210"
}
```

### Example Response
```
{
  "message": "OTP verified successfully",
  "status": "Created"
}
```

### Notes & Usage Tips
- Ensure that the `aadhaar` and `mobileNumber` provided match the details used during OTP generation.
- The OTP is typically valid for a short duration (e.g., 5 minutes).
- If the OTP verification fails, ensure the OTP is correct and not expired, and retry the process.
- Use the `{{baseUrl}}` variable to switch between different environments (development, QA, production) easily.
- Make sure your environment or collection has the correct `bearerToken` set for authentication.

item.name: verifyOTPonCommunicationMobileForABHAprofile
Verify OTP on communication mobile number

request.description:
## Verify OTP on Communication Mobile Number

### 1\. Summary

This endpoint verifies the OTP sent to a user's communication mobile number as part of the ABHA profile update or verification process. It is typically used to authenticate the user before allowing changes to their mobile number associated with their ABHA profile.

### 2\. Required Request Headers

- `Content-Type: application/json`  
    Specifies that the request body is in JSON format.
    
- `Accept: application/json`  
    Indicates that the client expects a JSON response.
    
- `Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}`  
    (If required by your API security policy) Use the bearer token for authentication. Replace `{{bearerToken}}` with your valid token or ensure the variable is set in your environment.
    

### 3\. Request Body Fields

```
{
  "oldMobileNumber": "<string>",
  "otp": "<string>",
  "aadhaar": "<string>"
}

 ```

- **oldMobileNumber**: The user's previous mobile number registered with the ABHA profile.
    
- **otp**: The One-Time Password received on the communication mobile number.
    
- **aadhaar**: The Aadhaar number associated with the user's ABHA profile.
    

### 4\. Variables Used

- `{{baseUrl}}`: The base URL for the API. Set this variable in your environment to point to the correct API server.
    
- `{{bearerToken}}`: The bearer token for authorization. Ensure this variable is set with a valid token if the endpoint requires authentication.
    

### 5\. Example Request

```
POST {{baseUrl}}/verifyOTPonCommunicationMobileForABHAprofile
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json
Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}
{
  "oldMobileNumber": "9876543210",
  "otp": "123456",
  "aadhaar": "123412341234"
}

 ```

#### Example Response (201 Created)

```
{
  "message": "OTP verified successfully",
  "status": "Created"
}

 ```

### 6\. Notes & Usage Tips

- Ensure the `baseUrl` and `bearerToken` variables are correctly set in your environment before sending the request.
    
- The OTP should be valid and not expired.
    
- If you receive an authentication error, check if your bearer token is still valid.
    
- The endpoint may return different status codes for invalid OTP, expired OTP, or unauthorized access. Always handle error responses appropriately in your client application.

This endpoint retrieves suggested ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) addresses based on the provided Aadhaar number or related profile information. It is typically used to assist users in selecting or creating an ABHA address during registration or profile updates.

---

### **Endpoint**

`POST {{baseUrl}}/fetchAbhaAddressSuggestionsForABHAprofile`

---

### **Required Headers**

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    
- `Accept: application/json`
    
- `Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}` _(if required by your API authentication scheme)_
    

---

### **Authentication**

This endpoint requires Bearer Token authentication. Ensure that the `{{bearerToken}}` variable is set with a valid token before making the request.

---

### **Request Body**

Send a JSON object in the request body. The structure may vary depending on the API implementation, but typically includes:

``` json
{
  "aadhaarNumber": "string" // The Aadhaar number for which to fetch ABHA address suggestions
}

 ```

_Replace the example with the actual required fields as per your API documentation._

---

### **Response**

A successful response returns a list of suggested ABHA addresses. Example response:

``` json
{
  "suggestions": [
    "john.doe@abdm",
    "johnd123@abdm"
  ]
}

 ```

- On success, HTTP status code `201 Created` is returned.
    
- On error, appropriate error codes and messages are provided in the response body.
    

---

### **Usage Notes**

- Ensure the Aadhaar number is valid and mapped to an existing profile.

item.name: register patient
patient
register

request.description:
## Register Patient

### 1. Summary
This endpoint registers a new patient in the Swasthx HMIS system. It collects comprehensive demographic, contact, and identification details for the patient, including guardian and parental information, address, and ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) details. The endpoint is typically used during patient onboarding at a healthcare facility.

### 2. Request Body Schema
The request body must be sent as JSON with the following structure:

```json
{
  "patientInfo": {
    "salutation": "<string>",
    "name": "<string>",
    "gender": "<string>",
    "religion": "<string>",
    "mobileNumber": "<string>",
    "speciality": "<string>",
    "subUnit": "<string>",
    "age": {
      "years": "<string>",
      "months": "<string>",
      "days": "<string>"
    }
  },
  "patientGuardian": {
    "name": "<string>",
    "relation": "<string>",
    "mobileNumber": "<string>"
  },
  "patientAddress": {
    "address": "<string>",
    "cityDistrict": "<string>",
    "postOffice": "<string>",
    "policeStation": "<string>",
    "pinCode": "<string>"
  },
  "patientParentsInfo": {
    "motherName": "<string>",
    "motherMobileNumber": "<string>",
    "fatherName": "<string>",
    "fatherMobileNumber": "<string>"
  },
  "patientAbhaDetails": {
    "AbhaAddress": "<string>",
    "AbhaNumber": "<string>"
  },
  "doctorName": "<string>"
}
```

#### Field Explanations
- **patientInfo**: Basic patient details.
  - `salutation`: Title (e.g., Mr., Ms., Dr.).
  - `name`: Full name of the patient.
  - `gender`: Gender identity.
  - `religion`: Religion of the patient.
  - `mobileNumber`: Contact number.
  - `speciality`: Patient's medical specialty (if applicable).
  - `subUnit`: Sub-unit or department (if applicable).
  - `age`: Patient's age split into years, months, and days.
- **patientGuardian**: Guardian's details (for minors or dependents).
  - `name`: Guardian's name.
  - `relation`: Relationship to patient.
  - `mobileNumber`: Guardian's contact number.
- **patientAddress**: Residential address.
  - `address`: Street address.
  - `cityDistrict`: City or district.
  - `postOffice`: Post office name.
  - `policeStation`: Police station jurisdiction.
  - `pinCode`: Postal code.
- **patientParentsInfo**: Parental information.
  - `motherName`, `motherMobileNumber`, `fatherName`, `fatherMobileNumber`: Names and contact numbers.
- **patientAbhaDetails**: ABHA (Ayushman Bharat Health Account) details.
  - `AbhaAddress`: ABHA address.
  - `AbhaNumber`: ABHA number.
- **doctorName**: Name of the registering doctor.

### 3. Authentication Requirements
- **Type**: Bearer Token (passed as `Authorization: Bearer <token>` header)
- **Header**: `Content-Type: application/json`
- Ensure you have a valid token before making this request.

### 4. Sample Request
```http
POST {{baseUrl}}/patient/register
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer <token>

{
  "patientInfo": {
    "salutation": "Mr.",
    "name": "John Doe",
    "gender": "Male",
    "religion": "Hindu",
    "mobileNumber": "9876543210",
    "speciality": "General",
    "subUnit": "Ward 1",
    "age": { "years": "30", "months": "0", "days": "0" }
  },
  "patientGuardian": {
    "name": "Jane Doe",
    "relation": "Wife",
    "mobileNumber": "9876543211"
  },
  "patientAddress": {
    "address": "123 Main St",
    "cityDistrict": "Kolkata",
    "postOffice": "Park Street",
    "policeStation": "Bhowanipore",
    "pinCode": "700016"
  },
  "patientParentsInfo": {
    "motherName": "Mary Doe",
    "motherMobileNumber": "9876543212",
    "fatherName": "Richard Doe",
    "fatherMobileNumber": "9876543213"
  },
  "patientAbhaDetails": {
    "AbhaAddress": "john@abha",
    "AbhaNumber": "1234-5678-9012"
  },
  "doctorName": "Dr. Smith"
}
```

### Sample Response
```json
{
  "status": "Created"
}
```

---
**References:**
- [register Patient (UID: 46178638-56fbaccd-9ba2-4478-ac9e-209fb91219a8)](request/46178638-56fbaccd-9ba2-4478-ac9e-209fb91219a8)
- [register Patient (UID: 46178638-24e4b11a-b319-4343-9b3d-5e2b46511147)](request/46178638-24e4b11a-b319-4343-9b3d-5e2b46511147)

request.description:
## Overview

This endpoint is used to **discover care contexts for a patient** in the Health Information Provider (HIP) system. It is typically called by a gateway or client application to retrieve all care contexts associated with a patient, based on their identifiers and demographic information.

## HTTP Method and Endpoint

- **Method:** `POST`
    
- **URL:** `{{baseUrl}}/api/v3/hip/patient/care-context/discover`
    - `{{baseUrl}}` is an environment or collection variable representing the base URL of the HIP API. Ensure this variable is set in your active environment.
        

## Required Headers

| Header | Value | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Content-Type | application/json | Indicates the request body format |

## Request Body Schema

The request body must be a JSON object with the following structure:

``` json
{
  "transactionId": "<string>",
  "patient": {
    "id": "<string>",
    "verifiedIdentifiers": [
      { "type": "<string>", "value": "<string>" },
      { "type": "<string>", "value": "<string>" }
    ],
    "unverifiedIdentifiers": [
      { "type": "<string>", "value": "<string>" },
      { "type": "<string>", "value": "<string>" }
    ],
    "name": "<string>",
    "gender": "<string>",
    "yearOfBirth": <number>
  }
}

 ```

### Field Explanations

- **transactionId**: Unique identifier for this discovery transaction (string).
    
- **patient**: Object containing patient details:
    - **id**: Patient's unique identifier (string).
        
    - **verifiedIdentifiers**: Array of objects with `type` and `value` for identifiers that have been verified (e.g., mobile, health ID).
        
    - **unverifiedIdentifiers**: Array of objects with `type` and `value` for identifiers that are not yet verified.
        
    - **name**: Patient's full name (string).
        
    - **gender**: Patient's gender (string).
        
    - **yearOfBirth**: Patient's year of birth (number).
        

## Example Request

``` json
{
  "transactionId": "1234567890",
  "patient": {
    "id": "patient-001",
    "verifiedIdentifiers": [
      { "type": "MOBILE", "value": "9876543210" }
    ],
    "unverifiedIdentifiers": [
      { "type": "EMAIL", "value": "user@example.com" }
    ],
    "name": "John Doe",
    "gender": "M",
    "yearOfBirth": 1985
  }
}

 ```

## Example Responses

### Success (200 OK)

See the saved example: [Successfully processed discovery request](https://request/46178638-a938dc2a-a367-42a4-95a1-17842d2e2e3e)

### Error (500 Internal Server Error)

See the saved example: [Internal server error](https://request/46178638-22748bda-1dbc-4375-96fc-afb62e2b2e3e)

## Notes

- **Authentication:** This endpoint may require authentication (e.g., Bearer token or API key) as per your HIP API configuration. Refer to your collection or environment setup for details.
    
- **Variable Usage:** The `{{baseUrl}}` variable should be set in your environment to point to the correct HIP API server.
    
- For more details, see similar requests: [Handle patient discovery request from gateway](https://request/46178638-59400cd1-2af2-4e57-8dc8-4c65e7cd5e8c), [Handle patient discovery request from gateway](https://request/46178638-c213e86c-e9d1-4bfa-9e10-f68422e78aac).

request.description:
## Purpose
This endpoint is used by the Health Information Provider (HIP) to receive notifications about the status of a consent request. The notification informs the HIP about the outcome of a consent flow, including details about the consent granted, status, and related metadata.

## Required Request Headers
- `Content-Type: application/json`

## Request Body Schema
The request body must be a JSON object with the following structure:

```json
{
  "requestId": "<string>",
  "timestamp": "<string>",
  "notification": {
    "status": "<string>",
    "consentId": "<string>",
    "consentDetail": {
      "schemaVersion": "<string>",
      "consentId": "<string>",
      "createdAt": "<string>",
      "patient": {
        "id": "<string>"
      },
      "careContexts": [
        {
          "patientReference": "<string>",
          "careContextReference": "<string>"
        }
      ],
      "purpose": {
        "text": "<string>",
        "code": "<string>",
        "refUri": "<string>"
      },
      "hip": {
        "id": "<string>",
        "name": "<string>"
      },
      "consentManager": {
        "id": "<string>"
      },
      "hiTypes": ["<string>"],
      "permission": {
        "accessMode": "<string>",
        "dateRange": {
          "from": "<string>",
          "to": "<string>"
        },
        "dataEraseAt": "<string>",
        "frequency": {
          "unit": "<string>",
          "value": "<number>",
          "repeats": "<number>"
        }
      }
    },
    "signature": "<string>",
    "grantAcknowledgement": <boolean>
  }
}
```

### Field Explanations
- **requestId**: Unique identifier for the consent notification request.
- **timestamp**: ISO 8601 timestamp when the notification is generated.
- **notification.status**: Status of the consent (e.g., GRANTED, DENIED, REVOKED).
- **notification.consentId**: Unique identifier for the consent.
- **notification.consentDetail**: Detailed information about the consent.
  - **schemaVersion**: Version of the consent schema.
  - **consentId**: Consent identifier (repeated for clarity).
  - **createdAt**: Timestamp when the consent was created.
  - **patient.id**: Unique patient identifier.
  - **careContexts**: Array of care context objects, each with:
    - **patientReference**: Reference to the patient.
    - **careContextReference**: Reference to the care context.
  - **purpose**: Purpose of data access.
    - **text**: Human-readable purpose description.
    - **code**: Purpose code.
    - **refUri**: Reference URI for the purpose.
  - **hip**: Health Information Provider details.
    - **id**: HIP identifier.
    - **name**: HIP name.
  - **consentManager.id**: Identifier for the consent manager.
  - **hiTypes**: Array of health information types covered by the consent.
  - **permission**: Consent permissions.
    - **accessMode**: Mode of access (e.g., VIEW, STORE).
    - **dateRange**: Validity period for the consent.
      - **from**: Start date.
      - **to**: End date.
    - **dataEraseAt**: When the data should be erased.
    - **frequency**: Frequency of data access.
      - **unit**: Unit of frequency (e.g., days, months).
      - **value**: Frequency value.
      - **repeats**: Number of repeats.
- **notification.signature**: Digital signature for verification.
- **notification.grantAcknowledgement**: Boolean indicating if the grant was acknowledged.

## Example Request and Response
- [Successfully processed consent notification](request/46178638-497dd8c7-9d8a-4721-be17-d4ab58f...)
- [Internal server error](request/46178638-af9f4776-fdcf-4664-bf3a-979f4b7...)

You can view these saved examples for sample payloads and responses.

## Authentication & Usage Notes
- This endpoint typically requires authentication as per your API's security scheme (e.g., OAuth2, API Key, etc.). Ensure you include the necessary authentication headers if required by your deployment.
- Use this endpoint only to notify the HIP about consent status changes as part of the ABDM consent flow.
- The request body must strictly adhere to the schema above for successful processing.

---

**References:**
- [Handle consent notification from gateway](request/46178638-9652f4e1-632f-4284-b622-f2f3a9517693)

item.name: consent
hiuinitiateconsent

request.description:
# Initiate consent request as HIU

## 1) Summary / Purpose

Initiates a consent request from a Health Information User (HIU) to a patient/holder via the consent manager. Use this to request access to health information for a specified doctor and context.

## 2) Endpoint and Method

- Method: POST
    
- Endpoint: `{{baseUrl}}/hiuinitiateconsent`
    

## 3) Auth Requirements

- Authentication: Inherit from collection or environment if configured. If a bearer/API key is required for your deployment, ensure it is set via the active environment or collection-level auth.
    
- Active environment: `wb-prod-env`
    

## 4) Request Headers

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    

## 5) Request Body

- Body type: raw (application/json)
    
- Schema (fields and types):
    
    - `doctorID` (string, required): Identifier of the requesting doctor.
        
    - `data` (string, required): Opaque context or payload relevant to the consent. Provide the encoded or plain string as required by your backend.
        
    - `expiryTime` (string, required): ISO 8601 timestamp or backend-accepted time format indicating when the consent request expires.
        
    - `consentCreatedTime` (string, required): ISO 8601 timestamp when the consent request is created.
        
    - `consent` (object, required): Consent details object. Structure depends on backend specification; include purpose, HI types/scopes, and duration where applicable.
        
- Example payload:
    
    ``` json
    {
    "doctorID": "DOC-12345",
    "data": "OPD_VISIT_2024_12_01",
    "expiryTime": "2025-12-31T23:59:59Z",
    "consentCreatedTime": "2025-01-15T10:30:00Z",
    "consent": {}
    }
    
     ```
    

## 6) Responses

- 201 Created — Request recorded successfully.
    - See saved example: "Request Successful" for the representative 201 response.
        
- 4xx — Validation/auth errors (e.g., missing required fields, invalid timestamps, or missing auth).
    
- 5xx — Server-side errors.
    

## 7) Variables Used and Sources

- `{{baseUrl}}` — from active environment `wb-prod-env`. Ensure it points to the correct API base (e.g., `https://api.example.com`).
    

## 8) Notes for Testing and Common Pitfalls

- Ensure time fields are in the accepted format (prefer ISO 8601 with timezone, e.g., `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ`).
    
- Keep `consent` object structure aligned with the backend contract; if unknown, consult API spec and incrementally test with minimal fields.
    
- Confirm that collection/environment auth is correctly set if your endpoint enforces authentication.
    
- Use the correct environment so `{{baseUrl}}` resolves to the intended server.
    
- Do not change the request method, URL, headers, or body mode when testing.

request.description:
# Create Subscription (HIU)

## Overview

Creates a subscription for a patient’s health data categories with a specified validity period so the HIU can receive consented data notifications.

## Endpoint

- Method: POST
    
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/hiu/subscription/createSubscription
    

## Authentication

- Bearer token expected in Authorization header or inherited from auth settings (e.g., {{bearerToken}})
    

## Required Headers

- Content-Type: application/json
    

## Request Body

Content-Type: application/json

```
{
  "subscription": {
    "purpose": {
      "text": "<string>",
      "code": "<string>",
      "refUri": "<string>"
    },
    "patient": { "id": "<string>" },
    "hiu": { "id": "<string>" },
    "categories": ["<string>", "<string>"],
    "period": { "from": "<string>", "to": "<string>" }
  }
}

 ```

## Field Details

- subscription.purpose.text: Human-readable description of purpose (e.g., "Treatment").
    
- subscription.purpose.code: Purpose code (internal or ABDM aligned).
    
- subscription.purpose.refUri: Reference URI for purpose taxonomy (optional).
    
- subscription.patient.id: Patient identifier (e.g., ABHA address or system-specific ID).
    
- subscription.hiu.id: HIU identifier requesting the subscription.
    
- subscription.categories: List of data categories to subscribe to (e.g., "OPConsultation", "Diagnostics").
    
- subscription.period.from: ISO 8601 timestamp for start of validity.
    
- subscription.period.to: ISO 8601 timestamp for end of validity.
    

## Example

```
{
  "subscription": {
    "purpose": {
      "text": "Treatment",
      "code": "TREAT",
      "refUri": "https://example.org/purpose-codes#TREAT"
    },
    "patient": { "id": "john.doe@abdm" },
    "hiu": { "id": "SWASTHX-HIU-001" },
    "categories": ["OPConsultation", "Diagnostics"],
    "period": { "from": "2025-01-01T00:00:00Z", "to": "2025-12-31T23:59:59Z" }
  }
}

 ```

## Success Response

- 200/201: Subscription created. Response includes subscription ID and status.
    

## Error Responses

- 400: Invalid payload or missing required fields.
    
- 401/403: Authentication/authorization failure (check bearer token or workspace auth settings).
    
- 409: Duplicate or overlapping active subscription.
    
- 500: Server error.
    

## Notes

- Ensure {{baseUrl}} is set via the active environment (currently wb-prod-env).
    
- This request currently has no pre-request or test scripts; add tests later if you need validation.
    
- Related references for structure and sample values are derived from requests named "Create subscription request for user abha address" available in this workspace.

request.description:
## Overview

Callback endpoint for HIUs to notify subscription request approval or denial.

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/api/v3/hiu/subscription-requests/hiu/notify`
    
- Purpose: Informs the system of the final status of a subscription request raised by an HIU (approve/deny) along with reason and subscription details.
    

## Authentication

- Typically secured using a Bearer token. Ensure your workspace/environment provides a valid token.
    

## Headers

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    

## Request Body

Send a JSON object with the following shape:

``` json
{
  "notification": {
    "subscriptionRequestId": "<string>",
    "status": "approved | denied",
    "reason": "<string>",
    "subscription": {
      "id": "<string>",
      "patient": { "id": "<string>" },
      "hiu": {
        "id": "<string>",
        "name": "<string>",
        "type": "<string>"
      },
      "sources": [
        {
          "hip": { /* HIP identifier object */ },
          "categories": ["<string>", "<string>"],
          "period": { "from": "<ISO-8601>", "to": "<ISO-8601>" }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

 ```

### Field details

- `notification.subscriptionRequestId` (string, required): The ID of the original subscription request.
    
- `notification.status` (string, required): Final decision — `approved` or `denied`.
    
- `notification.reason` (string, optional/required when denied): Human-readable reason for the decision.
    
- `notification.subscription` (object, required on approval): Details of the created subscription when approved.
    - `id` (string): Subscription identifier.
        
    - `patient.id` (string): Patient identifier.
        
    - `hiu` (object): HIU metadata.
        
    - `sources[].hip` (object): HIP identifier payload.
        
    - `sources[].categories` (array\[string\]): Data categories requested.
        
    - `sources[].period.from|to` (string, ISO-8601): Time range for data.
        

## Sample payloads

Approved:

``` json
{
  "notification": {
    "subscriptionRequestId": "subreq-123",
    "status": "approved",
    "reason": "Meets policy criteria",
    "subscription": {
      "id": "sub-789",
      "patient": { "id": "patient-456" },
      "hiu": { "id": "hiu-01", "name": "Acme HIU", "type": "HIU" },
      "sources": [
        {
          "hip": { "id": "hip-55" },
          "categories": ["DiagnosticReport", "Observation"],
          "period": { "from": "2024-01-01T00:00:00Z", "to": "2024-12-31T23:59:59Z" }
        }
      ]
    }
  }
}

 ```

Denied:

``` json
{
  "notification": {
    "subscriptionRequestId": "subreq-123",
    "status": "denied",
    "reason": "Insufficient patient consent"
  }
}

 ```

## Responses

- 200 OK — Callback successfully acknowledged. See saved example: "callback successfully acknowledged".
    
- 500 Internal Server Error — See saved example: "Internal server error".
    

Saved examples:

- OK: see example in this request.
    
- Error: see example in this request.
    

## Notes

- Variables used: `{{baseUrl}}` (from environment), `{{bearerToken}}` if applicable.
    
- This documentation is based on similarly named requests within this workspace including:
    - callback for HIU subscription approved/deny status (current request)
        
    - callback for HIU subscription approved/deny status (related reference)

This is callbacks folder has three folder to retrive the link and align with the care context linked

- On hit API
    
- Request approved and denied api
    
- Care context linked api

This folder contains APIs related to subscription flow at HIU ends

- HIU can create and send the subscription request to patient ABHA address
    
- HIU can recieved the callback whever the patient approve/deny the request
    
- HIU can receive the callback whever any new care context in linked with patient ABHA address

This folder contains M3 flows only:

- find patient
    
- consent management
    
    - first the HIU creates consent for user
        
    - user grants it , the HIU and HIP receives this information in callback.
        
    - all the information about consent whether it is granted, denied, revoked is stored by HIU
        
- data fetch
    
    - once the consent is granted by user, HIU can request the health records data from all the HIPs
        
    - upon receiving the data, HIU will be able to view it.
        

So this folder contains APIs for all the processes related to consent management and datat fetch.

This folder contains the Milestone 2 & 3 flows.

The flows are as follows:

- hip initiated flow
    
- discover flow
    
- notify patient once records are created.
    
- data fetch from HIP once consent is granted.
    
- consent management
    
    - creation -> requesting data from HIP -> viewing the records
        

Other then these there are flows which have involvement of callback completely like data transfer flow in HIP. The initiation step is from consent callback, that is also included in this folder.

item.description:
## Generate OTP for Aadhaar Verification

This endpoint generates a One-Time Password (OTP) for Aadhaar verification as part of the HPR registration process. The OTP is sent to the mobile number linked with the provided Aadhaar number.

### Request

- **Method:** `POST`
    
- **URL:** `//HPR/register/aadhaar/generateOtp`
    
- **Headers:**
    
    - `Content-Type: application/json`
        
    - `Authorization: Bearer` (required)
        

### Authentication

This endpoint requires Bearer token authentication. Include a valid Bearer token in the `Authorization` header.

### Usage Notes

- Ensure the Aadhaar number is valid and linked to a mobile number to receive the OTP.
    
- The Bearer token must have appropriate permissions to access this endpoint.
    
- OTPs are time-limited and should be used promptly for verification.

item.description:
**Purpose:**  
This endpoint verifies the OTP (One-Time Password) sent to a user's Aadhaar number as part of the Aadhaar authentication process. It is typically used after initiating an Aadhaar OTP request and is essential for validating the user's identity.

**Request Body:**

- `otp` (string): The OTP received by the user on their registered mobile number linked with Aadhaar.
    
- `aadhaar` (string): The 12-digit Aadhaar number of the user.
    
- `txnId` (string): The transaction ID received from the OTP generation step. This links the OTP verification to the correct authentication session.

request.description:
**Endpoint:** Create HPR ID

This POST endpoint is used to register a new Healthcare Professional Registry (HPR) ID using Aadhaar-based details. It is typically part of the onboarding process for healthcare professionals in the system.

---

### Purpose

Creates a new HPR ID by accepting Aadhaar and personal details, along with authentication and category information. The endpoint validates the provided data and, upon success, generates a unique HPR ID for the user.

---

### Authentication

- Requires a valid Bearer Token in the `Authorization` header.
    
- The token should be provided as an environment variable: `{{bearerToken}}`.
    

---

### Request Body (JSON)

All fields are required unless specified otherwise:

- `aadhaar` (string): Aadhaar number of the professional.
    
- `txnId` (string): Transaction ID associated with Aadhaar verification.
    
- `email` (string): Email address of the professional.
    
- `firstName` (string): First name.
    
- `middleName` (string, optional): Middle name.
    
- `lastName` (string): Last name.
    
- `password` (string): Password for the account.
    
- `profilePhoto` (string): Base64-encoded profile photo.
    
- `hprId` (string): Desired HPR ID (if applicable).
    
- `hpCategoryCode` (number): Code representing the healthcare professional category.
    
- `hpSubCategoryCode` (number): Code for the sub-category.
    
- `stateCode` (string): State code.
    
- `districtCode` (string): District code.
    
- `role` (number): Role identifier.
    

Example body:

``` json
{
  "aadhaar": "123456789012",
  "txnId": "abc123txn",
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "firstName": "John",
  "middleName": "A.",
  "lastName": "Doe",
  "password": "securePassword",
  "profilePhoto": "<base64string>",
  "hprId": "HPR123456",
  "hpCategoryCode": 1,
  "hpSubCategoryCode": 2,
  "stateCode": "KA",
  "districtCode": "BLR",
  "role": 3
}

 ```

---

### Possible Responses

- **200 OK**: HPR ID created successfully. Returns the created HPR ID and related details.
    
- **403 Forbidden**: Unauthorized access. Returned if authentication fails or the user does not have permission.
    

Refer to the saved examples for sample responses:

- [HPR ID created successfully](https://request/46178638-07a38553-3e2a-4248-8c71-39394cce513f)
    
- [Unauthorized access](https://request/46178638-07a38553-3e2a-4248-8c71-39394cce513f)
    

---

**Variables Used:**

- `{{baseUrl}}`: Base URL for the API.
    
- `{{bearerToken}}`: Bearer token for authentication.
    

---

**Headers:**

- `Content-Type: application/json`

**Purpose:**  
This endpoint allows you to search for healthcare facilities based on various criteria such as ownership, location, and facility details. It is useful for retrieving a paginated list of facilities that match the provided filters.

**Request Body Parameters:**

- `ownershipCode` (string, optional): Filter facilities by ownership type.
    
- `stateLGDCode` (string, optional): Filter by the state LGD (Local Government Directory) code.
    
- `districtLGDCode` (string, optional): Filter by the district LGD code.
    
- `subDistrictLGDCode` (string, optional): Filter by the sub-district LGD code.
    
- `pincode` (string, optional): Filter by the facility's pincode.
    
- `facilityId` (string, optional): Search for a specific facility by its unique ID.
    
- `facilityName` (string, optional): Search for facilities by name.
    
- `page` (integer, required): The page number for pagination (default: 1).
    
- `resultsPerPage` (integer, required): Number of results per page (default: 10).
    

**Headers:**

- `Content-Type: application/json`
    

**Expected Responses:**

- **200 OK**: Facilities retrieved successfully. Returns a list of facilities matching the search criteria.
    
    - _Example response:_
        
        ``` json
          {
            "status": "OK",
            "data": [
              {
                "facilityId": "12345",
                "facilityName": "ABC Hospital",
                ...
              }
            ]
          }
        
         ```
        
- **500 Internal Server Error**: An error occurred while processing the request.
    
    - _Example response:_
        
        ``` json
          {
            "status": "Internal Server Error",
            "message": "An unexpected error occurred."
          }
        
         ```
        

**Usage Notes:**

- At least one filter parameter should be provided to narrow down the search results.
    
- Pagination is supported via the `page` and `resultsPerPage` parameters.
    
- Ensure that the `Content-Type` header is set to `application/json`.
    

---

# Register a New Health Professional

This endpoint allows you to register a new health professional in the system. It is typically used by authorized administrators or onboarding systems to create a comprehensive profile for a practitioner, including personal, professional, and contact details.

```json
    },

      "publicMobileNumber": "<string>",
      "publicMobileNumberCode": "<string>",
      "publicMobileNumberStatus": "<string>",
      "landLineNumber": "<string>",
      "landLineNumberCode": "<string>",
      "publicEmail": "<string>",
      "publicEmailStatus": "<string>"
    },
    "registrationAcademic": {
      "category": "<string>",
      "registrationData": [
        {
          "registeredWithCouncil": "<string>",
          "registrationNumber": "<string>",
          "registrationCertificate": "<string>",
          "isNameDifferentInCertificate": "<string>",
          "proofOfNameChangeCertificate": "<string>",
          "registrationDate": "<string>",
          "isPermanentOrRenewable": "<string>",
          "renewableDueDate": "<string>",
          "categoryId": "<string>",
          "qualifications": [
            {
              "nameOfDegreeOrDiplomaObtained": "<string>",
              "country": "<string>",
              "state": "<string>",
              "college": "<string>",
              "university": "<string>",
              "monthOfAwardingDegreeDiploma": "<string>",
              "yearOfAwardingDegreeDiploma": "<string>",
              "degreeCertificate": { "fileType": "<string>", "data": "<string>" },
              "isNameDifferentInCertificate": "<string>",
              "proofOfNameChangeCertificate": "<string>"
            }
          ]
        }
      ]
    },
    "currentWorkDetails": {
      "currentlyWorking": "<string>",
      "purposeOfWork": "<string>",
      "chooseWorkStatus": <number>,
      "reasonForNotWorking": "<string>",
      "certificateAttachment": { "fileType": "<string>", "data": "<string>" },
      "facilityDeclarationData": {
        "facilityId": "<string>",
        "facilityName": "<string>",
        "facilityAddress": "<string>",
        "facilityPincode": "<string>",
        "state": "<string>",
        "district": "<string>",
        "facilityType": "<string>",
        "facilityDepartment": "<string>",
        "facilityDesignation": "<string>",
        "ministry": { "ministry": "MinistryMOR ( Mo Railways )" }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### **Key Fields**
- **hprID** *(string, required)*: Unique identifier for the health professional.
- **practitioner** *(object, required)*: Contains all practitioner details.
  - **profilePhoto** *(string, optional)*: URL or base64 of the profile photo.
  - **healthProfessionalType** *(string, required)*: Type/category of the professional.
  - **officialMobile/officialEmail** *(string, required)*: Official contact details.
  - **personalInformation** *(object, required)*: Name, family, and demographic details.
  - **registrationAcademic** *(object, required)*: Registration and academic credentials.
  - **currentWorkDetails** *(object, optional)*: Current employment or work status.

> **Note:** Some fields are nested objects or arrays. Refer to the schema above for structure.

---

## **Expected Responses**

### **Success**
- **200 OK**: Professional registered successfully.
  ```json
  {
    "message": "Professional registered successfully",
    "status": "OK"
  }
  ```

### **Error Scenarios**
- **403 Forbidden**: Unauthorized access (invalid or missing bearer token).
  ```json
  {
    "message": "Unauthorized access",
    "status": "Forbidden"
  }
  ```
- **400 Bad Request**: Invalid or missing required fields.
- **500 Internal Server Error**: Server-side error.

---

## **Examples**
- See saved examples for [Professional registered successfully](request/46178638-a73f501d-8bef-4146-9cc1-0555c5b01a94) and [Unauthorized access](request/46178638-a73f501d-8bef-4146-9cc1-0555c5b01a94).

item.name: upload-documents

request.description:
## Upload documents for professional registration

Use this endpoint to upload one or more documents for an HPR professional registration workflow.

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/HPR/register/professional/upload-documents`
    
- Auth/Vars: Uses `{{baseUrl}}`. If a Bearer token is required, set it in a header or variable (e.g., `{{bearerToken}}`) as per your auth flow.
    
- Headers:
    - `Content-Type: application/json`
        

### Request body

Send a JSON payload with the HPR transaction token and an array of document objects.

``` json
{
  "hpr_Token": "<string>",
  "document": [
    {
      "document_id": "<string>",
      "document_type": "<string>",
      "fileType": "<string>",
      "data": "<string>"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

Field details:

- `hpr_Token` (string, required): Session/transaction token for the HPR registration flow.
    
- `document` (array, required): One or more document items.
    - `document_id` (string, required): Unique identifier for the document within your system.
        
    - `document_type` (string, required): Business/category type of the document (e.g., ID_PROOF, ADDRESS_PROOF, DEGREE_CERTIFICATE).
        
    - `fileType` (string, required): MIME subtype or file extension (e.g., `pdf`, `jpeg`, `png`).
        
    - `data` (string, required): Base64-encoded file content. Ensure the string is properly base64 without data URL prefix.
        

Example:

``` json
{
  "hpr_Token": "2d1f0c7a-3f8a-4f74-9d3b-123456789abc",
  "document": [
    {
      "document_id": "doc-001",
      "document_type": "DEGREE_CERTIFICATE",
      "fileType": "pdf",
      "data": "JVBERi0xLjQKJ...base64..."
    },
    {
      "document_id": "doc-002",
      "document_type": "ID_PROOF",
      "fileType": "jpeg",
      "data": "/9j/4AAQSkZJRgABAQAAAQABAAD...base64..."
    }
  ]
}

 ```

### Responses

This request already has saved examples you can reference:

- OK — Documents uploaded successfully. See example: “Documents uploaded successfully”.
    
- 500 — Internal server error. See example: “Internal server error”.
    

Add more examples to document other outcomes (e.g., 400 invalid payload, 401 unauthorized) if needed.

### Notes

- Ensure the `{{baseUrl}}` environment variable is set (active environment: wb-dev-env).
    
- Large files should be reasonably sized after base64 encoding; consider server limits.
    
- If authentication is required, include an Authorization header, e.g.: `Authorization: Bearer {{bearerToken}}`.
    

### References

- Related requests with similar schema: Upload documents for professional registration (two instances in this workspace).
    
- Source of body schema guidance: Derived from existing request body and possible schema hints within this workspace.

item.name: updateProfessionalMobileRegenerate

request.description:
## Regenerate OTP for mobile verification

Regenerates and sends a new OTP (one-time password) to the professional’s registered mobile number for verification purposes. Use this when the previous OTP expired or was not delivered.

- Method: POST
    
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/HPR/professional/updateProfessionalMobileRegenerate`
    
- Auth: Bearer token (via `{{bearerToken}}`)
    
- Headers: `Content-Type: application/json`
    

### Path and query parameters

None.

### Request body

Send a JSON payload identifying the professional whose mobile OTP needs to be regenerated.

Suggested schema (confirm with your backend if needed):

``` json
{
  "mobile": "+91XXXXXXXXXX",
  "abhaAddress": "john@abdm",
  "txnId": "<tracking id for audit (optional)>"
}

 ```

Example:

``` json
{
  "mobile": "+919876543210",
  "abhaAddress": "doctor.rao@abdm",
  "txnId": "{{trackId}}"
}

 ```

### Authentication

Provide a valid bearer token. You can store it in a variable and reference it as `{{bearerToken}}`.

### Environment variables

- `{{baseUrl}}` (required): Base API host for the environment (e.g., dev/qa/prod).
    
- `{{bearerToken}}` (required): Access token with permission to trigger OTP regeneration.
    
- `{{trackId}}` (optional): Correlation ID for tracing (if supported).
    

### Responses

- 200 OK — OTP regenerated successfully. See example: “OTP regenerated successfully”.
    
- 403 Forbidden — Unauthorized access (missing/invalid token or insufficient scope). See example: “Unauthorized access”.
    

These examples are saved under this request and power documentation and mocks.

### Notes

- Rate limits or throttling may apply at the gateway level.
    
- If you repeatedly get 403, verify the `{{bearerToken}}` is current and that the calling client has the right roles/scopes.
    
- Ensure the mobile number is registered for the given professional.
    

### Changelog

- Initial documentation added.

request.description:
# Get system of medicines

Retrieves the master list of systems of medicine configured in Swasthx HMIS.

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/HPR/masterAPI/system-of-medicines`
    
- Auth: Bearer token via variable `{{bearerToken}}` (set at request/collection/environment level). If auth is inherited, ensure the token variable is present.
    
- Path params: none
    
- Query params: none
    
- Request body: none
    

## Headers

- Authorization: `Bearer {{bearerToken}}` (if required by your deployment)
    
- Accept: `application/json`
    

## Variables

- `{{baseUrl}}`: Base URL for the HMIS API (set in the active environment)
    
- `{{bearerToken}}`: Access token for authenticated calls
    

## Success response (200)

Returns an array of systems of medicine.

Example schema (representative):

``` json
[
  {
    "id": "string",
    "code": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "isActive": true
  }
]

 ```

See saved example: "Returns list of system of medicines".

## Error responses

- 401 Unauthorized: Missing/invalid token
    
- 500 Internal Server Error
    

See saved example: "Internal server error".

## Usage notes

- Ensure the active environment defines `baseUrl`.
    
- If requests are failing with 401, verify `bearerToken` is set or inherited.
    
- This endpoint is read-only and safe to cache according to your client policy.

item.description:
## **Get Countries**

Fetches the complete list of countries configured within the Swasthx HMIS master data module.

**Method:** GET  
**URL:** `//HPR/masterAPI/countries`

**Authentication:**  
  
Uses Bearer Token from variable `{{bearerToken}}`.  
  
If the request inherits authorization, make sure `{{bearerToken}}` is set in the environment/collection.

**Required Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{bearerToken}}`
    
- Accept: `application/json`

Check if HPR ID exists in the system

request.description:
### Check if HPR ID exists in the system

Verifies whether a given HPR ID is present and associated with an account in the system.

- Method: `POST`
    
- URL: `{{baseUrl}}/HPR/login/checkHPRidpresent`
    
- Query parameters:
    - `hipID` (string, required): The HPR ID to check. Example: `HIP123456`.
        

Authentication

- Expects a valid bearer token. Use the `{{bearerToken}}` variable or your active environment's auth configuration.
    

Variables

- `{{baseUrl}}` – Base URL for the HIMS API (provided by the active environment).
    
- `{{bearerToken}}` – Bearer token used for authorization.
    

Request body

- None. This endpoint uses only a query parameter.
    

Possible responses (see saved examples)

- HPR ID check successful: 200 OK – The provided HPR ID exists.
    
- Unauthorized access: 403 Forbidden – Missing/invalid credentials.
    

References

- Related requests and examples informing these details:
    - Check if HPR ID exists in the system (current request)
        
    - Check if HPR ID exists in the system (sibling reference)
        

Notes

- Ensure the `hipID` query parameter is present; the request will not work without it.
    
- Use environments like `wb-dev-env` to resolve `{{baseUrl}}`.

request.description:
## Purpose

This endpoint allows you to search for healthcare facilities using optional filters. You can filter results by `searchField`, `stateCode`, `districtCode`, and `facilityType` to narrow down the list of facilities returned.

## Authentication

A Bearer token is required in the `Authorization` header to access this endpoint.

## Request Body

Send a JSON object with the following fields (all are optional):

- `searchField` (string): A search term to match facility names or other attributes.
    
- `stateCode` (string): The code representing the state to filter facilities.
    
- `districtCode` (string): The code representing the district to filter facilities.
    
- `facilityType` (string): The type of facility to filter (e.g., hospital, clinic).
    

### Example Request Body

``` json
{
  "searchField": "",
  "stateCode": "",
  "districtCode": "",
  "facilityType": ""
}

 ```

## Response

The response will contain a list of facilities matching the provided filters.

> **Note:** The exact response structure will depend on the implementation. (Add a sample response here if available.)

item.name: Fetche Facility Type

request.description:
## Fetch Facility Type

### 1. Purpose
This endpoint retrieves a list of facility types based on the provided facility category and state code. It is typically used to populate dropdowns or filter options in healthcare management systems.

### 2. Required Headers & Variables
- **Authorization**: `Bearer {{token}}`
- **Content-Type**: `application/json`
- **Variables:**
  - `{{baseUrl}}`: Base URL of the API (e.g., `https://api.swasthx.com/v1`)
  - `{{token}}`: Bearer token for authentication (e.g., `eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...`)

### 3. Request Body
- **Schema:**
  ```json
  {
    "facilityCategory": "string",
    "stateCode": "string"
  }
  ```
- **Example:**
  ```json
  {
    "facilityCategory": "Hospital",
    "stateCode": "WB"
  }
  ```

### 4. Expected Response
- **Success (200 OK):**
  ```json
  {
    "status": "success",
    "data": [
      {
        "facilityTypeId": "string",
        "facilityTypeName": "string"
      }
    ]
  }
  ```
- **Error (e.g., 400/401):**
  ```json
  {
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Error message here"
  }
  ```

### 5. Usage Notes
- Both `facilityCategory` and `stateCode` are required fields in the request body.
- Ensure the `Authorization` header contains a valid bearer token.
- The endpoint is case-sensitive for both parameters.
- Use this endpoint to dynamically fetch facility types relevant to a specific category and state.

# **Health Facility Registry (HFR)**

This module contains all APIs used for submitting and retrieving health facility information within Swasthx HMIS.

Each API represents a step in the multi-stage facility registration workflow.

item.name: HFR-Register
Get Linked Facilities
item.description:
Returns a list of facilities linked to a specific HPR ID. A single practitioner or organization may manage multiple facilities.

### **Method:** GET

### **URL:**`--/HFR/facility/getLinkedFacilities?hprID={{hprID}}`

### **Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{token}}`
    

### **Query Params:**

- `hprID`: Identifier of the healthcare provider
    

### **Notes for Developers:**

- Use this API to show facility lists in admin dashboards.
    
- Response includes facility name, trackId, submission status, etc.
    
- Token required for authorization and security.

item.name: Get Complete From Data
item.description:
Retrieves the **entire form data** submitted for a facility.  
  
Useful for:

- Edit mode
    
- Review/approval
    
- Displaying data in dashboards
    
- Draft resume
    

### **Method:** GET

### **URL: --**`/HFR/facility/getCompleteFormData?hprIdNumber={{hprIdNumber}}&type={{type}}&facilityId={{facilityId}}`

### **Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{token}}`
    

### **Query Params:**

- `hprIdNumber`: HPR ID of the facility owner
    
- `type`: Mode of retrieval (draft/submitted/etc.)
    
- `facilityId`: ID of the facility (optional based on workflow)
    

### **Notes for Developers:**

- Use this API for pre-populating forms.
    
- Depending on `type`, the API may return partial (draft) or complete data.
    
- Must have a valid user token.

item.name: Submit Complete Facility Details
item.description:
This API finalizes the facility registration workflow by combining **all submitted steps**:

- Basic facility details
    
- Additional details
    
- Detailed infrastructure/services
    
- Final acknowledgment & verification info
    

Once submitted, the facility data enters verification or approval workflow.

### **Method:** POST

### **URL:** `https://websitedevelopment.api.swasthx.com/HFR/submitFacilityDetails?trackId={{trackId}}`

### **Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{token}}`
    
- Content-Type: `application/json`
    

### **Body:**

Raw JSON (from variable `{{submitFacilityDetailsDto}}`)

### **Notes for Developers:**

- Must be called _only after all previous steps are completed_.
    
- A failed validation at this stage returns field-level errors.
    
- Consider capturing the facility ID from the response.

item.name: Submit Details Facilities
item.description:
This API is used to submit **extensive, item-level data** such as:

- Infrastructure details
    
- Equipment list
    
- Bed capacity
    
- Compliance and certifications
    
- Emergency services
    

Requires the same `trackId` and links all detailed data under the same registration flow.

### **Method:** POST

### **URL:**

`https://websitedevelopment.api.swasthx.com/HFR/detailedFacilityInformation?trackId={{trackId}}`

### **Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{token}}`
    
- Content-Type: `application/json`
    

### **Body:**

Raw JSON (from variable `{{detailedInformationDto}}`)

### **Notes for Developers:**

- This step can be large due to multiple nested arrays.
    
- Validate content with DTO schema before submission.
    
- Must be called **after** both Step 1 and Step 2.

item.name: Submit Additional Facility
item.description:
### **Description**

This API stores **secondary facility details**, often optional but important (services offered, staffing capacity, available departments, etc.).  
  
This step requires the `trackId` from Step 1 to link the data.

### **Method:** POST

### **URL:** `https://websitedevelopment.api.swasthx.com/HFR/additionalFacilityInformation?trackId={{trackId}}`

### **Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{token}}`
    
- Content-Type: `application/json`
    

### **Body:**

Raw JSON (from variable `{{additionalInformationDto}}`)

### **Notes for Developers:**

- `trackId` acts as the unique workflow identifier.
    
- API rejects the request if `trackId` is missing or expired.
    
- This step must be completed **after** the basic information submission.

item.name: Submit Basic Facilities Info
item.description:
### **Description**

This API is used to submit the **first step** of the facility registration process.

It captures the basic profile of the health facility (name, location, ownership type, contact details, etc.).

A successful submission generates a `trackId` used for subsequent steps.

### **Method:** POST

### **URL:** `https://websitedevelopment.api.swasthx.com/HFR/basicFacilityInformation`

### **Headers:**

- Authorization: `Bearer {{token}}`
    
- Content-Type: `application/json`
    

### **Body:**

Raw JSON (loaded from variable `{{basicFacilityInformationDto}}`)

### **Notes for Developers:**

- This is the entry point of the registration workflow.
    
- Ensure the response contains the generated `trackId`.
    
- Save `trackId` for the next steps (`Additional`, `Detailed`, and `Complete Submission`).

# **Health Facility Registry (HFR)**

This module contains all APIs used for submitting and retrieving health facility information within Swasthx HMIS.  
  
Each API represents a step in the multi-stage facility registration workflow.

## Health Facility Registry

- Health Facility Registry is a comprehensive repository of health facilities of the country across modern and traditional systems of medicine.  
     
    
- It includes both public and private health facilities including hospitals, clinics, diagnostic laboratories and imaging centers, pharmacies, etc.  
     
    
- ABDM maintains the national directory of all Healthcare Facilities. A facility needs to first enrol in the health facility registry.

This folder contains the flow related to health professional registration

- registration using AADHAAR number
    
- professional form submission APIs
    
    - registering the professional
        
    - listing the documents submttied by professinal
        
    - upload the docuements for professional
        
    - fetch documents details
        
    - update the professinal details
        
- login flow
    
    - login with passowrd
        
    - login with HPRID or username
        
    - login with MOBILE OTP or AADHAAR OTP
        
    - login with mobile number
        
- master APIs
    
    - contains the APIs to get data while submitting the form
        
        - data like degrees, colleges, languages etc.
            

This folder contains the APIs related to health professinal registration.

item.name: doctorCheckinUserSlot

request.description:
Purpose
PATCH endpoint to check in a user for a specific doctor’s slot in the HIMS system. Use it to mark a patient’s presence/attendance for a time-bound slot, optionally tagging the action.

Method and URL
- Method: PATCH
- URL: {{baseUrl}}/doctor-profile/doctorCheckinUserSlot

Headers
- Content-Type: application/json

Authentication and Variables
- Base URL is provided via the {{baseUrl}} variable (configure it in your active environment or collection variables).
- If your deployment requires auth, inherit or set it at the folder/collection level. This request does not set auth explicitly.

Request Body
- Body type: raw (application/json)
- JSON schema and fields:
  {
    "mobileNumber": "string",  // Patient’s mobile number used to identify the user
    "doctorID": "string",      // Unique identifier of the doctor
    "status": "string",        // Check-in state (e.g., "checked_in", "arrived", etc.)
    "time": "string",          // Target slot time (ISO 8601 or server-accepted format)
    "tag": "string"            // Optional tag/remark for this check-in
  }

Example Payloads
- Minimal:
  {
    "mobileNumber": "9876543210",
    "doctorID": "DOC-123",
    "status": "checked_in",
    "time": "2025-01-01T10:30:00Z"
  }
- With tag:
  {
    "mobileNumber": "9876543210",
    "doctorID": "DOC-123",
    "status": "arrived",
    "time": "2025-01-01T10:30:00Z",
    "tag": "front-desk"
  }

Expected Responses
- 201 Created / Success: The check-in was recorded successfully. See the saved example: "Request Successful" for an illustrative response.
- 4xx: Validation or business rule errors (e.g., missing fields, invalid slot, user not found).
- 5xx: Server error.

Usage Notes
- Ensure {{baseUrl}} points to the correct environment (dev/stage/prod).
- Keep Content-Type as application/json.
- status and time should match what the backend expects; consult service rules if custom statuses or time formats are required.
- This request has no pre-request or test scripts and will inherit any auth defined at higher scopes.

References
- Saved example: Request Successful

item.name: ackPatient

request.description:
## Acknowledge Patient

This endpoint allows a doctor to acknowledge a patient for a scheduled appointment. When called, it confirms that the doctor has recognized and accepted the patient for their appointment slot.

### Query Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
|-----------|------|----------|-------------|
| `appointmentID` | string | Yes | The unique identifier of the appointment to acknowledge |

### Response

| Status Code | Description |
|-------------|-------------|
| `201 Created` | Patient successfully acknowledged for the appointment |

request.description:
## get Patient Assessment Data

Retrieve assessment data for a patient for a given doctor. This endpoint returns the patient’s assessment details associated with the specified doctor.

- Method: `GET`
- Endpoint: `{{baseUrl}}/doctor-profile/getPatientAssessmentData`
- Request Type: HTTP

### Query Parameters
- `doctorID` (string, required) — Unique identifier of the doctor.
  - Example: `D-12345`
- `patientNumber` (string, required) — Unique identifier/number of the patient.
  - Example: `P-67890`

The above parameter keys and types are based on existing usages in the workspace requests named “get Patient Assessment Data”.

### Variables
- `{{baseUrl}}` — Base URL for the HMIS API. Ensure the active environment defines this value.

### Authentication
Use your workspace’s configured auth (if required by your backend). Common patterns include a bearer token or API key set at the collection/environment level. If set at a higher scope, this request will inherit it.

### Success Response
- Status: `200 OK` (typical)
- Body: JSON object containing patient assessment data.

This request also has a saved example named “Request Successful” which can be referenced for a sample successful response.

### Error Responses
- `400 Bad Request` — Missing or invalid query parameters.
- `401/403` — Authentication/authorization failure.
- `404 Not Found` — No assessment data found for the given identifiers.
- `5xx` — Server-side error.

### Notes
- No request body is required.
- Ensure `doctorID` and `patientNumber` are URL-encoded when necessary.
- You can run this request as part of the Swasthx HMIS collection workflows or monitors.

item.name: doctorBookUserSlotFromWeb
doctor Book User Slot From Web

request.description:
## Overview
Books a patient appointment slot from the web on behalf of a doctor. This operation creates or confirms an appointment in the doctor’s schedule.

- Endpoint: `POST {{baseUrl}}/doctor-profile/doctorBookUserSlotFromWeb`
- Content type: `application/json`
- Auth: Provide your workspace-appropriate auth (e.g., bearer token or API key) via collection/environment settings if required by your backend.

## Variables
- `{{baseUrl}}`: Base URL for your deployment (set this in an environment).

## Headers
- `Content-Type: application/json`

## Request Body
JSON object with the following fields:

```json
{
  "DoctorID": "<string>",
  "orderID": "<string>",
  "appointmentID": "<string>",
  "tag": "BookedByDoctor",
  "PatientInfo": {
    "name": "<string>",
    "abhaAddress": "<string>",
    "abhaNumber": "<string>",
    "UHID": "<string>",
    "age": "<string>",
    "dob": "<string>",
    "gender": "<string>",
    "mobileNumber": "<string>",
    "address": {
      "streetName": "<string>",
      "city": "<string>",
      "state": "<string>",
      "country": "<string>",
      "pincode": "<string>"
    }
  },
  "BookedSlot": {
    "status": "<string>",
    "paymentStatus": "UNPAID",
    "time": "<string>",
    "duration": "<string>",
    "typeOfSlot": "<string>",
    "whichSlot": "<string>",
    "whichDay": "<string>"
  }
}
```

### Field notes
- `DoctorID` (string): Identifier of the doctor for whom the slot is being booked.
- `orderID` (string): Client-side order or transaction reference, if applicable.
- `appointmentID` (string): Use if updating/confirming an existing provisional appointment; otherwise optional per backend rules.
- `tag` (string): Recommended value `BookedByDoctor`.
- `PatientInfo` (object): Patient demographics and identifiers.
  - `abhaAddress`, `abhaNumber` (string): National health ID details (optional if not applicable).
  - `UHID` (string): Facility-specific patient ID.
  - `dob` (string): Date of birth; format expected by backend (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD).
  - `gender` (string): One of your system’s accepted values (e.g., Male/Female/Other).
  - `mobileNumber` (string): Contact number with country code if required.
  - `address` (object): Postal address.
- `BookedSlot` (object): Details of the slot to book.
  - `status` (string): Booking state (e.g., requested/confirmed), per backend.
  - `paymentStatus` (string): Defaults to `UNPAID` unless your flow marks it paid.
  - `time` (string): Start time of the appointment (e.g., 2025-01-31T10:30:00Z or HH:mm).
  - `duration` (string): Duration (e.g., `15m`, `30m`).
  - `typeOfSlot` (string): Virtual/In-person/etc., as supported.
  - `whichSlot` (string): Slot identifier within the schedule.
  - `whichDay` (string): Day reference if required by scheduling logic.

## Example
This request has a saved example demonstrating a successful creation flow. See: [Request Successful](example/46178638-0b6b88b6-306e-4550-8019-197b417...) under the parent request [doctor Book User Slot From Web](request/46178638-0935cb9c-4904-4d48-8a6b-b548bbcce85b).

## Responses
- 201 Created: Slot booked successfully (see saved example).
- 400 Bad Request: Missing or invalid fields.
- 401/403 Unauthorized/Forbidden: Authentication/authorization issues.
- 404 Not Found: Doctor or slot not found.
- 409 Conflict: Slot already booked.
- 500 Server Error: Unexpected error on server.

## Notes
- Ensure your active environment supplies a valid `{{baseUrl}}`.
- If your API requires auth, configure it at the collection or folder level so this request inherits it.

---
References for this request’s structure were derived from existing items in your workspace: [doctor Book User Slot From Web](request/46178638-0935cb9c-4904-4d48-8a6b-b548bbcce85b) and a related request variant [doctor Book User Slot From Web](request/46178638-a767fc2b-3e6a-4821-88ca-e77be66feb79).

item.name: cancel appointment
item.description:
## **Cancel Appointment**

Cancels an existing appointment using the unique `orderID`.  
  
This API is typically used when a doctor, admin, or system needs to cancel a booked appointment due to unavailability, patient request, or operational reasons. Once cancelled, the appointment status is updated and the slot becomes available again (if applicable).

**Request:**

- **Method:** **PATCH**
    
- {{baseUrl}}/appointment/cancel/{{orderID}}
    

**Path Parameter:**

- `orderID` – Unique identifier of the appointment/order to be cancelled
    

**Headers:**

- `Authorization: Bearer {{wb-auth-token}}`
    
- `Content-Type: application/json`
    

**Request Body (Optional):**

```
{
  "cancelReason": "Doctor unavailable",
  "cancelledBy": "doctor"
}

 ```

**Authentication:**

- Bearer token required
    

**Expected Behavior:**

- Updates appointment status to **CANCELLED**
    
- Frees up the booked time slot
    
- Prevents further check-in or reschedule actions for this order

In this Folder doctor appointment booking flow doctor/admin can booking patient appointment

- Doctor Book user Slot - POST
    
- Patient Slot Book - POST
    
- doctor cancel user slot - PATCH
    
- doctor check in user slot - PATCH
    
- doctor reschedule user slot - patch
    
- doctor OPD data -
    
- ack patient - post
    
- Get patient Assessment data - Get
    
- get patient Access Data - Get
